title: using pub macro_rules outside of the crate ICEs with  `Missing span for DefIndex(3)`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
using [pub_macro_rules](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/78855) on the latest nightly, i get this compiler panic.

index varies according to the code that's running as you might expect

### Code

in a project called 'repro'

main.rs:
```rust
fn main() {
    repro::fail!(recv);
}
```
lib.rs:
```rust
#![feature(pub_macro_rules)]
pub macro_rules! fail {
    ($x:expr) => { $x }
}
```

### Meta

```
> cargo version --verbose
```
